required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Gimatecan (ST1481) in Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib/II Study of Gimatecan (ST1481) for Small Cell Lung Cancer Patients Who Failed Standard Platinum-containing Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: This phase Ib/II clinical trial studies the safety and effect of Gimatecan in small cell lung cancer patients who failed the first-line standard platinum-containing chemotherapy. The chemotherapy will be given every four weeks.

primary_outcome.description: Phase Ib: Number of patients experienced any dose limited toxicity over the DLT period.
Phase Ib: Determination of recommended phase II dose of escalating dose of gimatecan for the phase II part of the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: To evaluate objective response rate every 8 weeks after the initiation of chemotherapy, up to 24 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with objective response assessed by best overall response (BOR) of either complete response(CR) or partial remission(PR) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause or the date of first documented disease progression whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The 2-year progression free survival of the whole group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: To evaluate disease control rate every 8 weeks after the initiation of chemotherapy, up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with disease control as assessed by best overall response (BOR) of either complete response(CR), partial remission(PR) or stable disease (SD) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First documented CR or PR, whichever is first recorded until the first assessment of PD, assessed up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The DoR applies only to patients whose BOR is either CR or PR. The duration is measured from the first documented response (CR or PR, whichever is first recorded) until the first assessment of Progressive Disease (PD).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause or the date of last follow-up whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The 2-year overall survival of the whole group.
Survival probability of patients calculated according to Kaplan-Meier curve at either 1 or 2 year.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the enrollment to 30 days later of the last chemotherapy.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence rate of treatment related adverse events of the whole group assessed by CTCAE v5.0.

arm_group.description: In Phase Ib study, patients will receive gimatecan at different dose level (0.4mg/m2, 0.6mg/m2,0.8mg/m2, oral, every 4 weeks) until progressive disease (PD).In Phase II study, patients will receive gimatecan at recommended phase II dose level.

intervention.description: Patients will receive gimatecan orally at the recommended dose level on day 1-5 every 4 weeks.

overall_official.affiliation: The Fifth Medical Center of the Chinese PLA General Hospital

facility.name: The Fifth Medical Center of General Hospital of the Chinese People's Liberation Army

results_reference.citation: Hurwitz JL, McCoy F, Scullin P, Fennell DA. New advances in the second-line treatment of small cell lung cancer. Oncologist. 2009 Oct;14(10):986-94. doi: 10.1634/theoncologist.2009-0026. Epub 2009 Oct 9. Review.

Owonikoko TK, Behera M, Chen Z, Bhimani C, Curran WJ, Khuri FR, Ramalingam SS. A systematic analysis of efficacy of second-line chemotherapy in sensitive and refractory small-cell lung cancer. J Thorac Oncol. 2012 May;7(5):866-72. doi: 10.1097/JTO.0b013e31824c7f4b.
